Node.definition: = action by which humans supervise, direct or oversee work (such as building or repairing) or worship (such as singing or playing instruments)
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans who find themselves in difficult circumstances put their trust in someone else, ► in order to find protection or safety

= referent to the way in which an event is performed; ► normally with the intention of finding out how, but often used in rhetorical questions in order to express one's conviction that that event in question cannot be performed at all (under the given circumstances)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= action by which humans or animals move quickly and nervously from one place to another, ► usually to escape impending danger
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= generic term for a small bird; ► usually clean and can therefore be eaten
= causative action by which humans bend a bow (קֶשֶׁת) by drawing its string towards them ► in order to shoot an arrow
= a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an object to be firmly located in a certain place

= pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment
= relatively thin string; ► used to hold a tent or similar construction in place, but also as bowstring; in Judges 16 used to tie down a person
= causative action by which humans launch arrows (חֵץ) with the help of a bow (קֶשֶׁת)
= state of total absence of light; ≈ associated with suffering and death
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: foundation; hence: = the principles on which a righteous society is built

Node.gloss: to tear down|to demolish|to ruin|to raze|to overthrow
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone tears down a construction
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a building or set of buildings, distinguished from other constructions or houses by its magnificence ► and function, which is either religious or political
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= large elaborate seat used by people in a position of authority or wealth

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= action by which humans focus their eyes on someone or something in order to see it well
literally: eyelids; hence: = a poetic reference to the eye (עַיִן)

= action by which humans or deities examine the character of other humans or deities by having them engage in a certain activity, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

= action by which humans or deities examine the character of other humans or deities by having them engage in a certain activity, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= to behave aggressively towards someone with which one has a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
literally: to send rain; hence: = causative action by which deities cause objects to fall from the sky ◄ like rain
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

= a pale yellow substance which burns readily in air; ◄ it is found in regions of vulcanic activity such as the Dead Sea area, and ► causes land to be infertile; ≈ it is associated with punishment from God

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped
= a rise of temperature, of natural cause
= small, bowl shaped container ► used for drinking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote one's portion in life, received from God
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= action of humans or deities that is in accordance with the requirements of the divine law and and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this type of behavior as a standard, which often requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
= action by which humans focus their eyes on someone or something in order to see it well
